name: Payhippo
headline: Loans to Nigeria's SMEs in under 3 hours
description:
Payhippo provides loans to small businesses in Africa in under 3 hours.

We made $42k in revenue in Nigeria in July 2021, growing 25% m/m with a 97% repayment rate.

founders.name: Zach Bijesse, Founder
founders.description:
Hi everyone! I'm Zach. My favorite thing in the world is music (been playing guitar for 15 years).
I used to be a certified weight loss specialist to pay the bills in undergrad. Started a mobile health app at the end of undergrad. 

But I also did a lot of activism. I'm most proud of creating this campaign: https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/28/opinion/bruni-emilios-great-race.html

Then started teaching in Manhattan to learn about impact in education.

Down to talk with fellow founders!

founders.name: Chioma Okotcha, Founder
founders.description:
Whether I'm building a company, analysing policies or leading a flag-football team in a league, I'm driven to make a difference/learn something. This could be profit, impact or winning the league championship. 

Happy to chat and connect.

Founded in 2019 and part of Y Combinator's Summer 2021 batch, Payhippo has made a significant impact in the lending space.

As of July 2021, the company reported a solid revenue figure of $42,000 in Nigeria, showcasing a robust month-over-month growth of 25%. Their impressive 97% repayment rate speaks volumes about their customer reliability and the effectiveness of their loan products.
